This ensures f (x + s) < f (x) unless the approximating Hessian B = B-inverted perpendicular differs significantly from H(x) or the scalar q > 0 is too small. Either one or both quantities may be updated after unsuccessful and successful steps alike. paper_title: Cubic overestimation and secant updating for unconstrained optimization of C-2,C-1 functions
